document_data.name: Grell
document_data.mainbody: The '''Grell language''' was a bizzare language spoken exclusively by [[grell]]s, a strange race of [[aberrations]], though due to its alien nature other creatures considered it to be hardly recognizable as a language.
document_data.Speakers: This language was exclusively known by grells,
document_data.Phonology:
Verbally this language consisted of various buzzing rasps, clicks,In the ''[[Monstrous Manual]]'', it is stated that grell utilize limited telepathy as part of their language. This aspect is not carried over in ''[[Lords of Madness: The Book of Aberrations]]'', however, the electrical component of Grell can be assumed to be mistaken for telepathy by other creatures due to its imperceptibly.

In order to conduct complex conversations in this language or to speak exclusively through its electrical component, grells had to be within {{SI|60|ft|long=yes}} of one another. For communication from greater distances, only the audible component could be used. In ideal conditions, verbal speech in the Grell language could be carried for hundreds of feet.

When it came to communicating exclusively through the audible or electrical component, grell typically did so in order to convey simple messages such as alarms, hunting signals, or calling for help. The electrical component component in particular was sometimes used to among grell to silently signal ambushes or to coordinate sudden attacks.

Dictionary.Unknown: The word used to refer to "lesser beings" in Grell was synonymous with the word used to refer to "food".What exactly this word is was never stated within the cited text. Among [[w:c:spelljammer:Colonial grell|colonial grell]], that being the spacefaring grell of [[Wildspace]], this same term was also used to refer to [[w:c:spelljammer:groundling|groundling]] grell, as they viewed themselves to be superior to their terrestrial cousins.<ref><ref group="note" name="word" />
